alert.note: Alert for Adams; Buffalo; Hall; Kearney; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 6:56PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Franklin, northwestern Webster, Adams, Kearney, southeastern Buffalo and southwestern Hall Counties through 745 PM CDT... At 656 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Wood River to near Kenesaw to near Norman to Axtell. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Norman around 700 PM CDT. Juniata around 705 PM CDT. Holstein around 715 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Hildreth, Roseland, Hastings, Upland, Campbell, Bladen and Ayr. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 268 and 306. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
